title: Guide Dog
description:
A guide (or Seeing Eye) dog, trained to help lead a person who is blind or visually impaired. Generally depicted as a yellowish-brown Labrador Retriever on all fours facing left, equipped with a harness and handle. Many platforms additionally include a collar.

Not to be confused with ğŸ•‍ğŸ¦º Service Dog, though their popular applications may overlap.

Twitter implements the same dog as its ğŸ• Dog. Samsung and Twitter’s guide dogs have green harnesses.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the guide dog emoji is depicted with a friendly and attentive demeanor, its form crafted with Apple's characteristic smooth gradients and soft rounded edges. The dog's fur has a gentle sheen, suggesting soft textures under realistic lighting, and its collar with a harness is clearly defined, emphasizing its role as a trusted companion. This emoji on Apple devices conveys loyalty, assistance, and a sense of dependable guidance, often used to express appreciation for help or to represent service animals.
